title: Compilation fails when same trait apears twice in type bounds with different lifetimes.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried this code:

```rust
trait Foo<'a> {}

fn foo<'a, 'b, T: Foo<'a> + Foo<'b>>() {}
```

[Here's link to playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=dfeb407ee38fe3164c4d9f42663d5696)

I expected to see this happen: Successful compilation

Instead, this happened: Compilation failed

```
error[[E0283]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0283): type annotations needed
 --> src/lib.rs:4:19
  |
4 | fn foo<'a, 'b, T: Foo<'a> + Foo<'b>>() {}
  |                   ^^^^^^^ cannot infer type for type parameter `T`
  |
  = note: cannot satisfy `T: Foo<'a>`
```

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.60.0 (7737e0b5c 2022-04-04)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 7737e0b5c4103216d6fd8cf941b7ab9bdbaace7c
commit-date: 2022-04-04
host: aarch64-apple-darwin
release: 1.60.0
LLVM version: 14.0.0
```
